text:
Thank you to everyone who provided feedback in the polls! I do have one other question for you if you get a chance.

*When you first set up the boilerplate, what is/was the first thing you changed?*
(Think of adjustments for your personal/teams workflow, any performance adjustments, etc)
Everything related to fonts, Colors, Content width, line-heights
Yeah the few times I've used the boiler plate I always change the way that fonts are installed.
Browsers don't cache third party URLs anymore the way that they used too
So using Google fonts directly from Google is kind of a No-No anymore
If you serve them directly from your server so their first party domains the files get cached across all pages
I also change the menu classes and all of that good stuff because I'm not a huge fan of the JavaScript that HubSpot uses for the menu so I just nix all that
All of this is super helpful, keep it coming, seriously.

FYI this is the generator that I used to get the base for the locally installed Google fonts that I use. <https://google-webfonts-helper.herokuapp.com/fonts|https://google-webfonts-helper.herokuapp.com/fonts>
It's always up to date because it uses the fonts API
And I almost always only use modern browser version because in reality nobody really uses eot or ttf anymore
And for HubSpot information that is an open source project
